Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or female, 6 years or older at the baseline visit.

2. Any condition that may interfere with the participant's ability to participate in the study.
3. Current participation in any interventional clinical trial which modifies participant care.
4. Use of Dupixent within 6 months of the baseline visit.
5. Not willing to sign the Informed Consent Form.

Certainly! Here are the full criteria we have designed for your clinical trial:

Inclusion Criteria:
1. Admitted to a facility with a plan for spontaneous or induced vaginal delivery.
2. In early labor (cervical dilation of 6 cm or less per local standard) and at least 37 weeks gestation.
3. Age 18 or above.
4. Confirmation of the presence of a single live fetus in the cephalic position by Doptone.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Non-emancipated minors.
2. Plan for Cesarean delivery or history of cesarean section prior to enrollment.
3. Unknown gestational age.
4. Advanced labor (cervical dilation greater than 6 cm or 10 cm per local standards) and pushing or too distressed to understand, confirm, or give informed consent.
5. Not capable of giving consent due to other health problems (e.g., obstetric emergencies, mental disorders).
6. Any medical condition considered a contraindication, including a contraindication to sildenafil therapy as judged by site investigators.
7. Any maternal medical condition or status that precludes informed consent.

Fantastic! We have completed the design of all the criteria for the clinical trial. Here is the full list of criteria:

Inclusion Criteria:
1. Informed Consent signed by the subject.
2. ≥ 18 years of age.
3. Recurrent, paroxysmal atrial fibrillation post repeat (≥2) pulmonary vein isolation.
4. Documentation of atrial fibrillation ≥3 months after the last atrial fibrillation ablation procedure by a 12-lead ECG or on a rhythm strip of ≥30 seconds duration.
5. Either an office systolic blood pressure ≥130 mmHg at the screening visit or antihypertensive drug therapy.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Persistent or permanent atrial fibrillation post pulmonary vein isolation.
2. Left ventricular ejection fraction <40%.
3. Severe aortic or mitral valve stenosis.
4. Treatment with amiodarone within the last 3 months.
5. Mandatory treatment with class I or III antiarrhythmic drugs.
6. History of syncope or orthostatic hypotension.
7. Prior renal denervation.
8. Renal artery stent or prior renal angioplasty.
9. Polycystic kidney disease, unilateral kidney, or history of renal transplant.
10. Estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) < 50mL/min.
11. Female of childbearing potential.
12. Life expectancy <1 year.
13. Enrolment in other interventional studies.
14. Diabetes mellitus type I.
15. Aortic grafts.
16. Episodes of atrial fibrillation on <6 days in the 3 months run-in phase.

I'm glad you understand the importance of ethical considerations. Based on our conversation, here are the full criteria for your clinical trial:

Inclusion Criteria:
1. All patients undergoing scheduled or semi-urgent cardiac surgery, with or without extracorporeal circulation.
2. Patients managed by complete vertical median sternotomy.
3. Patients benefiting from a Social Security scheme or benefiting from it through a third party.
4. Informed consent signed by the patient after clear and complete information about the clinical investigation.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with known allergies to any of the dressings (PREVENA®, PICO®, or standard dressing).
2. Patients with specific contraindications to the PICO® dressing.
3. Patients with sensitivity to silver (PREVENA® dressing).
4. Patients with a history of cardiac surgery prior to inclusion.
5. Patients with pre-existing skin infections (folliculitis) of the sternotomy site before the operation.
6. Patients operated on in urgent or extreme urgent situations (within 24 hours of admission).
7. Patients already participating in another clinical investigation that may impact the main objective of the trial.
8. Patients receiving ongoing antibiotherapy for endocarditis.
9. Patients undergoing minimal sternotomy (8-10 cm).
10. Pregnant or breastfeeding women, women of childbearing age who do not have effective contraception, or those with a positive pregnancy test at inclusion.

Inclusion Criteria:

5. Fully understand the purpose, benefits obtained, possible risks, and side effects of the study.
6. Willing to comply with all research requirements and procedures.
7. Understand the test procedure, read, and sign an appropriate Informed Consent Form indicating their willingness to participate.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Individuals currently receiving treatment for gastrointestinal symptoms.
2. Individuals with lactose intolerance.
3. Individuals suffering from other organic diseases currently that affect intestinal function.
4. Individuals who have made significant changes to their diet, exercise, or weight control methods in the last 3 months.
5. Individuals with a medical history or clinically examined diseases that may affect the evaluation of the test effect.
6. Individuals who abuse alcohol or other drugs, currently or in the past, which may cause bowel dysfunction or affect test result evaluation.
7. Individuals who take drugs frequently that may affect gastrointestinal function or the immune system according to the Principal Investigator's judgment.
8. Individuals who use laxatives or other substances that promote digestion 2 weeks before the trial.
9. Individuals who have consumed dairy products or other foods containing prebiotics/bacteria 10 days before the trial.

Excellent! Based on our conversation, here are the full criteria for the clinical trial:

Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or female aged 22 years or older.
2. Completed a PSG study within the last 6 months at the investigational site's sleep lab and obtained a baseline AHI confirming a diagnosis of mild to moderate obstructive sleep apnea.
3. Self-reported as a compliant user of the O2Vent Optima device, using it for at least 4 hours per night for at least 5 nights per week.
4. Completed the initial fitting optimization of the O2Vent Optima device.
5. Investigator determined that the participant could abstain from using the oral appliance or other sleep apnea therapies for up to 7 days.
6. Able to comply with all study requirements as outlined in the protocol.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Oral cavity infection or any other oral or dental condition that would limit the use of the O2Vent Optima oral appliance.
2. Concomitant diagnosed or suspected sleep disorders, including insomnia or central apnea.
3. History of any prior OSA surgical treatments, such as RF ablation treatment or palatal stent devices.
4. Use of any other prescription device for the treatment of OSA concurrently.
5. Female participants of child-bearing age who are pregnant or intending to become pregnant during the study participation period.
6. Significant change in weight (±10% or greater) since the completion of the diagnostic baseline PSG study.
7. On a non-stable dose of medications or other agents that may affect sleep and/or PSG (e.g., sedatives or hypnotics).
8. Consume more than 500 mg of caffeine per day (e.g., more than 8 cola-type beverages or 5 cups of coffee).
9. Consume more than 3 alcoholic drinks per day.
10. Currently enrolled in any other research study.

Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with Stage II to IV (M0) CSCC who are candidates for surgery but have an increased risk of recurrence and/or risk of disfigurement or loss of function.

3. Age ≥ 18 years.
4. Histologically confirmed diagnosis of invasive CSCC.
5. Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status score of 0 or 1.
6. Anticipated life expectancy > 12 weeks.
7. Adequate organ function.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Active solid malignancy or hematological malignancies within the last 5 years, except for certain exceptions.
2. Metastatic disease.
3. Use of steroids at a certain dosage within a specific time frame.
4. Active autoimmune diseases requiring systemic therapy within the last 5 years.
5. Active infections requiring therapy, including certain viral infections.
6. Breastfeeding, pregnancy, or inability to comply with recommended contraception.
7. Prior exposure to PD-L1/PD-1 inhibitors for the same lesion as enrollment.
8. Any anticancer treatment other than radiation therapy within 30 days of the initial administration of cemiplimab.
9. History of documented allergic reactions or acute hypersensitivity reactions attributed to antibody treatments.
10. Unwillingness to comply with all study-related procedures, including sample collection, imaging, and other protocol-specified time points.

Inclusion Criteria:
1. Histopathologically confirmed mantle cell lymphoma according to the 5th edition of the World Health Organization (WHO).
2. FISH with del(17p)/TP53 mutation or ≥65 years; or <65 years but chemotherapy intolerance.
3. Life expectancy of > 3 months (in the opinion of the investigator).

6. Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction (LVEF) ≥ 50%.
7. Agreeing to provide written informed consent prior to any special examination or procedure for the research on their own or legal representative.

Exclusion Criteria:
1. Pregnant or lactating women.
2. Known Hepatitis B Virus (HBV) and/or Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) infection.
3. With acquired or congenital immunodeficiency.
4. With congestive heart failure in 6 months before enrollment, New York Heart Association (NYHA) heart function class III or IV, or LVEF < 50%.
5. Known to be allergic to the test drug ingredients.
6. Diagnosed with or being treated for malignancy other than lymphoma.
7. With severe infection.
8. Substance abuse, medical, psychological, or social conditions that may interfere with the subjects' participation in the study or evaluation of the study results.
9. Deemed unsuitable for the group.
